site.title: Faro Guide
site.description: Complete guide to living and visiting Faro - information about transport, health, environment and leisure in the city

home.premium_notice_text: Download the Faro Premium Guide with offline maps, transport tips and detailed events.

pages.what_to_do_title: What to do today - Faro Guide
pages.about_description: Learn about the social objective, technologies and APIs used in the Faro Guide

about.hero_description: Learn about the social objective, technologies used and information about the development of the Faro Guide.
about.objective_p1: The Faro Guide is a public utility project developed with the aim of democratizing access to information about the city of Faro. Created independently and non-profit, this digital guide offers essential information for residents and visitors completely free of charge.
about.objective_p2: The main mission is to facilitate the daily life of those who live or visit Faro, bringing together in one place information about:
about.objective_p3: The project pays special attention to accessibility, including support for assistive technologies, dark mode and content available in Portuguese and English.
about.tech_description: The Faro Guide is developed with modern web technologies, prioritizing performance, accessibility and ease of maintenance:
about.tech_features: The project is 100% frontend, without the need for a backend server, which ensures faster loading and facilitates hosting and maintenance. It includes features such as:
about.tech_features_1: Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline support
about.apis_description: The project integrates data from multiple public and open sources to provide accurate and up-to-date information:
about.api_geo_desc: Portuguese API for geographic and demographic data of Portuguese municipalities.
about.api_cmf_desc: Official information about municipal services, transport and public facilities.
about.api_portal_desc: Data on health services, pharmacies and other public services.
about.api_turismo_desc: Official tourist information, events and points of interest.
about.api_osm_desc: Open collaborative maps used for geographic visualization.
about.api_proximo_desc: Public transport data and real-time schedules.
about.license_description: This project is open source and available under a free license for public use.
about.license_box_p1: ‚úì The content of this site can be freely consulted by anyone
about.license_box_p2: ‚úì The source code is available for consultation and contributions
about.license_box_p3: ‚úì The information is provided for educational and informational purposes
about.license_box_p4: ‚úì All data from external APIs is subject to the licenses of the respective sources
about.author_description: The Faro Guide is developed and maintained independently as a personal public utility project. The development is done voluntarily, non-profit, with the aim of contributing to the local community.
about.author_support: If this project is useful to you, consider supporting it voluntarily through the "Support the Project" button at the bottom of the page. The site will always remain 100% free and without advertising.
about.contact_description: For suggestions, corrections or questions about the project:

health.hero_description: Information about hospitals, health centers, pharmacies and emergency contacts in Faro.
health.pharmacies_info: There are several pharmacies in Faro, with a 24-hour rotation service.
health.pharmacies_on_duty_info: Pharmacies on duty: to check the nearest on-duty pharmacy call Linha Sa√∫de 24: 808 24 24 24 or visit www.portaldasfarmacias.pt
health.note_emergency: Important note: In case of a serious medical emergency, always call 112.

transport.hero_description: Complete guide on night mobility in Faro. Find information about last buses, taxis, TVDE and safe routes to move around the city at night.
transport.important_warning_text: Schedules may vary on weekends and public holidays. Please verify up-to-date schedules on the operator website or mobile app.

environment.hero_description: Information about sustainability, recycling and environmental care in Faro. Together we can make a difference for our city and the planet.
environment.what_to_recycle_intro: Learn about the different types of recycling containers (ecopoints) and what to dispose in each.
environment.ecopoints_description: Main locations of recycling containers (ecopoints) around the city of Faro:
environment.recolha_intro: Free bulky waste collection service (furniture, mattresses, large appliances, etc.)
environment.recolha_details: Bulky waste collection must be scheduled in advance with municipal services. Do not leave bulky items in public spaces without a booking.
environment.attention_text: Hazardous waste, construction debris and tyres should be delivered to the Ecocentre.
environment.ecocentro_intro: Collection centre for waste that cannot be deposited in regular recycling points.
environment.ecocentro_location: Zona Industrial de Faro, S√≠tio das Barradas
environment.ecocentro_accepts_label: ‚ôªÔ∏è What you can deposit at the Ecocentre:
environment.ecocentro_access: Free for residents (must present ID and proof of residence in Faro)
environment.tips_intro: Small actions that make a difference for a more sustainable Faro:
environment.tip_save_water_desc: Turn off the tap while brushing your teeth and prefer quick showers. An open tap wastes about 12 litres of water per minute.
environment.tip_save_energy_desc: Turn off devices on standby and prefer LED bulbs. They can reduce energy consumption by up to 80%.
environment.tip_use_reusable_desc: Always carry a reusable bag when shopping. A plastic bag takes hundreds of years to decompose.
environment.tip_sustainable_mobility_desc: Choose to walk, cycle or use public transport whenever possible. It reduces pollution and is good for health.
environment.tip_avoid_food_waste_desc: Plan meals, use leftovers and compost. In Portugal, about 1 million tonnes of food are wasted each year.
environment.tip_recycle_correctly_desc: Rinse containers before recycling and separate materials correctly. Recycling saves natural resources and energy.
environment.tip_care_greens_desc: Respect parks and gardens, don't litter and help keep Faro clean and green.
environment.tip_protect_ria_desc: The Ria Formosa is a natural treasure. Do not leave rubbish on beaches and respect local fauna and flora.

faq.find_answers: Find quickly the answer you're looking for:
faq.where_to_process_docs: Where to process official documents and services?
faq.where_to_ask_help: Where to ask for help and support?

activities.hero_title: What to do today in Faro
activities.simulator_description: Use the simulator below to find activities in Faro that match your interests and schedule.

leisure.hero_description: Discover the best of Faro: beaches, museums, green spaces and cultural events. Explore the city's natural and cultural heritage.
leisure.beaches_intro: Faro is the gateway to some of the Algarve's most beautiful beaches, located in the stunning Ria Formosa, a protected natural park.
leisure.islands_access_desc: Boats depart regularly from the Porta Nova pier (near the historic centre) and Faro Marina to the islands of the Ria Formosa.
leisure.islands_hours: Variable depending on season (more frequent in summer)
leisure.islands_prices: Between ‚Ç¨3 and ‚Ç¨15 (round trip, depending on destination)
leisure.museums_intro: Faro has a rich historical and cultural heritage, with museums that tell the region's story from Roman times to the present day.
leisure.museums_tip: üí° Tip: Many museums offer free entry or discounts on specific days. Check seasonal opening hours, which may vary between summer and winter.
leisure.parks_intro: Faro offers several green spaces perfect for relaxing, exercising or simply enjoying nature.
leisure.parks_birdwatch: üê¶ Birdwatching: The Ria Formosa is one of the best birdwatching spots in Europe, especially during migrations. Over 200 species have been recorded in the area.
leisure.events_intro: Faro has a rich cultural calendar, with traditional events, music festivals, gastronomy and religious celebrations throughout the year.
leisure.events_agenda: üì± Cultural Agenda: Check the full cultural agenda on the Faro City Council website or at the tourist office for exact dates and detailed programming.

restaurants.hero_description: Discover the best cafes, bakeries and restaurants in Faro. Search, filter and find the perfect place to eat or have a coffee in the Algarve capital.

hotels.hero_description: Find the perfect accommodation in Faro. Hotels, hostels, apartments and local stays for all tastes and budgets.

living.description: Essential guide for those who recently moved to Faro. Practical information about documents, transport, health, costs and city areas.
living.documents_intro: When moving to Faro, it's important to update your documents and registrations. Here are the essential steps:
living.financas_desc: You can update it online at www.portaldasfinancas.gov.pt
living.presencial_desc: Faro Tax Office, Rua Dr. Jos√© de Matos, 8000-503 Faro
living.docs_needed_desc: Citizen Card or ID, proof of address (rental contract or utility bill)
living.health_center_intro: To access public health services, you should register at a health center:
living.health_local_desc: Centro de Sa√∫de de Faro, Rua Le√£o Penedo, 8000-355 Faro
living.health_docs_desc: Citizen Card, SNS User Card (if you have one), proof of address
living.health_tip_desc: You can book online via the SNS portal
living.driving_license_intro: If you come from another EU country, you can use your driving license. For non-EU countries:
living.imt_desc: IMT - Instituto da Mobilidade e dos Transportes, EN125, 8000-126 Faro
living.municipal_services_intro: For issues related to the municipality (waste, water, municipal taxes):
living.documents_tip: üí° Important tip: Always bring copies of important documents and an updated proof of address.
living.transport_intro: Faro offers several public transport options and alternatives for travel within and outside the city.
living.transport_tip: üí° Mobility Tip: For more information about transport, check the dedicated Transport page.
living.health_section_intro: Faro has public and private health services to meet residents' needs.
living.health_tip: üí° For more details: Check the full Health page with addresses and a services map.
living.cost_intro: Faro offers a relatively affordable cost of living compared to other district capitals in Portugal, especially Lisbon and Porto.
living.cost_estimate: üí° Total Estimate: A single adult can live comfortably in Faro with ‚Ç¨900-1200/month (including rent). A couple may need ‚Ç¨1500-2000/month.
living.cost_note: Note: These values are estimates based on 2024 data and may vary. Housing prices have increased in recent years due to tourist demand.
living.zones_intro: Faro is divided into several areas, each with its own characteristics. Learn about the main neighborhoods:
living.zones_tip: üí° Choice Tip: Visit different areas before deciding where to live. Consider proximity to work, transport and services that matter to you.

offline.title: You are offline
offline.description: It looks like you're not connected to the internet. Some features may be limited, but you can still access the pages you've visited before.

voice_nav.not_supported: Voice navigation not supported in this browser
voice_nav.description: Use voice commands to navigate the site. Say phrases like 'Open restaurants' or 'Show map' to quickly access pages.
